00001 #include "Lgm/Lgm_QuadPack.h"
00002 
00003 /*
00004  *      QUADPACK DQAGS Routine converted to C 
00005  */
00006 int dqags(f, qpInfo, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr, neval, ier, limit, lenw, last, iwork, work)
00007 double  (*f)( double, _qpInfo *); /*  The integrand function -- I.e. the function to integrate       */
00008 _qpInfo *qpInfo;              /*  Auxilliary information to pass to function (to avoid making globals) */
00009 double   a;                   /*  Lower Limit of integration.                                    */
00010 double   b;                   /*  Upper limit of integration.                                    */
00011 double   epsabs;              /*  Absolute accuracy requested.                                   */
00012 double   epsrel;              /*  Relative accuracy requested.                                   */
00013 double  *result;              /*  The desired result. I.e. integral of f() from a to b           */
00014 double  *abserr;              /*  Estimate of the modulus of the absolute error in the result    */
00015 int     *neval;               /*  The number of integrand evaluations performed.                 */
00016 int     *ier;                 /*  Error flag. An error occurred if ier > 0. See below.           */
00017 int  limit;
00018 int  lenw;
00019 int *last;
00020 int *iwork;
00021 double  *work;
00022 {
00023 
00024 
00025 
00026     /*
00027      *
00028      *    Begin prologue:       dqags
00029      *    Date written:     800101   (yymmdd)
00030      *    Revision date:    830518   (yymmdd)
00031      *    Category no.:     h2a1a1
00032      *
00033      *    Keywords:         automatic integrator, general-purpose,
00034      *                      (end-point) singularities, extrapolation,
00035      *                      globally adaptive
00036      *
00037      *    Author:       piessens,robert,appl. math. & progr. div. - k.u.leuven
00038      *                  de doncker,elise,appl. math. & prog. div. - k.u.leuven
00039      *
00040      *    Purpose:          the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
00041      *                  definite integral  i = integral of f over (a,b),
00042      *                  hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
00043      *                  abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
00044      *
00045      *    Description:      Computation of a definite integral
00046      *                  standard fortran subroutine
00047      *                  double precision version
00048      *
00049      *
00050      *    Parameters:
00051      *         on entry
00052      *            f      - double precision
00053      *                     function subprogram defining the integrand
00054      *                     function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
00055      *                     declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
00056      *
00057      *            a      - double precision
00058      *                     lower limit of integration
00059      *
00060      *            b      - double precision
00061      *                     upper limit of integration
00062      *
00063      *            epsabs - double precision
00064      *                     absolute accuracy requested
00065      *            epsrel - double precision
00066      *                     relative accuracy requested
00067      *                     if  epsabs.le.0
00068      *                     and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
00069      *                     the routine will end with ier = 6.
00070      *
00071      *         on return
00072      *            result - double precision
00073      *                     approximation to the integral
00074      *
00075      *            abserr - double precision
00076      *                     estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
00077      *                     which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
00078      *
00079      *            neval  - integer
00080      *                     number of integrand evaluations
00081      *
00082      *            ier    - integer
00083      *                     ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
00084      *                             routine. it is assumed that the requested
00085      *                             accuracy has been achieved.
00086      *                     ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine
00087      *                             the estimates for integral and error are
00088      *                             less reliable. it is assumed that the
00089      *                             requested accuracy has not been achieved.
00090      *            error messages
00091      *                     ier = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
00092      *                             has been achieved. one can allow more sub-
00093      *                             divisions by increasing the value of limit
00094      *                             (and taking the according dimension
00095      *                             adjustments into account. however, if
00096      *                             this yields no improvement it is advised
00097      *                             to analyze the integrand in order to
00098      *                             determine the integration difficulties. if
00099      *                             the position of a local difficulty can be
00100      *                             determined (e.g. singularity,
00101      *                             discontinuity within the interval) one
00102      *                             will probably gain from splitting up the
00103      *                             interval at this point and calling the
00104      *                             integrator on the subranges. if possible,
00105      *                             an appropriate special-purpose integrator
00106      *                             should be used, which is designed for
00107      *                             handling the type of difficulty involved.
00108      *                         = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is detec-
00109      *                             ted, which prevents the requested
00110      *                             tolerance from being achieved.
00111      *                             the error may be under-estimated.
00112      *                         = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour
00113      *                             occurs at some points of the integration
00114      *                             interval.
00115      *                         = 4 the algorithm does not converge.
00116      *                             roundoff error is detected in the
00117      *                             extrapolation table. it is presumed that
00118      *                             the requested tolerance cannot be
00119      *                             achieved, and that the returned result is
00120      *                             the best which can be obtained.
00121      *                         = 5 the integral is probably divergent, or
00122      *                             slowly convergent. it must be noted that
00123      *                             divergence can occur with any other value
00124      *                             of ier.
00125      *                         = 6 the input is invalid, because
00126      *                             (epsabs.le.0 and
00127      *                              epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28)
00128      *                             or limit.lt.1 or lenw.lt.limit*4.
00129      *                             result, abserr, neval, last are set to
00130      *                             zero.except when limit or lenw is invalid,
00131      *                             iwork(1), work(limit*2+1) and
00132      *                             work(limit*3+1) are set to zero, work(1)
00133      *                             is set to a and work(limit+1) to b.
00134      *
00135      *         dimensioning parameters
00136      *            limit - integer
00137      *                    dimensioning parameter for iwork
00138      *                    limit determines the maximum number of subintervals
00139      *                    in the partition of the given integration interval
00140      *                    (a,b), limit.ge.1.
00141      *                    if limit.lt.1, the routine will end with ier = 6.
00142      *
00143      *            lenw  - integer
00144      *                    dimensioning parameter for work
00145      *                    lenw must be at least limit*4.
00146      *                    if lenw.lt.limit*4, the routine will end
00147      *                    with ier = 6.
00148      *
00149      *            last  - integer
00150      *                    on return, last equals the number of subintervals
00151      *                    produced in the subdivision process, detemines the
00152      *                    number of significant elements actually in the work
00153      *                    arrays.
00154      *
00155      *         work arrays
00156      *            iwork - integer
00157      *                    vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
00158      *                    elements of which contain pointers
00159      *                    to the error estimates over the subintervals
00160      *                    such that work(limit*3+iwork(1)),... ,
00161      *                    work(limit*3+iwork(k)) form a decreasing
00162      *                    sequence, with k = last if last.le.(limit/2+2),
00163      *                    and k = limit+1-last otherwise
00164      *
00165      *            work  - double precision
00166      *                    vector of dimension at least lenw
00167      *                    on return
00168      *                    work(1), ..., work(last) contain the left
00169      *                     end-points of the subintervals in the
00170      *                     partition of (a,b),
00171      *                    work(limit+1), ..., work(limit+last) contain
00172      *                     the right end-points,
00173      *                    work(limit*2+1), ..., work(limit*2+last) contain
00174      *                     the integral approximations over the subintervals,
00175      *                    work(limit*3+1), ..., work(limit*3+last)
00176      *                     contain the error estimates.
00177      *
00178      *     references  (none)
00179      *     routines called  dqagse,xerror
00180      *     end prologue  dqags
00181      *
00182      */
00183 
00184 
00185 
00186     int     lvl=0, l1, l2, l3;
00187 
00188 /*
00189 double TMPwork[600], TMPwork2[600], TMPwork3[600], TMPwork4[600];
00190 int TMPiwork[600];
00191 */
00192 
00193 
00194     /* First executable statement  dqags */
00195 
00196 
00197     /*
00198      *    Check validity of limit and lenw.
00199      */
00200     *ier = 6;
00201     *neval = 0;
00202     *last = 0;
00203     *result = 0.0;
00204     *abserr = 0.0;
00205 
00206     if( (limit < 1) || (lenw < limit*4) ) {
00207 
00208         if (*ier == 6) lvl = 1;
00209         if (*ier != 0) fprintf(stderr, "dqags: Abnormal return from dqags, ier = %d,  lvl = %d\n", *ier, lvl);
00210         return(-1);
00211 
00212     } else {
00213 
00214         /*
00215          *    Prepare call for dqagse.
00216          */
00217         l1 = limit+1;
00218         l2 = limit+l1;
00219         l3 = limit+l2;
00220 
00221 
00222         dqagse(f, qpInfo, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, limit, result, abserr, neval, ier, 
00223                 work, work+l1, work+l2, work+l3, iwork, last);
00224 
00225     }
00226 
00227 
00228 
00229     /*
00230      *    Call error handler if necessary.
00231      */
00232     lvl = 0;
00233 
00234 
00235     if(*ier == 6) lvl = 1;
00236     if(*ier != 0){ 
00237     fprintf(stderr, "dqags: Abnormal return from dqags, ier = %d,  lvl = %d\n", *ier, lvl);
00238         return(-1);
00239     } else {
00240         return(1);
00241     }
00242 
00243 
00244 }
00245 
00246 
00247 
00248 
00249 /*
00250  *      QUADPACK DQAGSE Routine converted to C
00251  */
00252 int dqagse(f, qpInfo, a, b, epsabs, epsrel, limit, result, abserr, neval, ier, alist, blist, rlist, elist, iord, last)
00253 double  (*f)( double, _qpInfo *); /*  The integrand function -- I.e. the function to integrate           */
00254 _qpInfo *qpInfo;                  /*  Auxilliary information to pass to function (to avoid making globals) */
00255 double   a;                   /*  Lower Limit of integration.                                 */
00256 double   b;                   /*  Upper limit of integration.                                 */
00257 double   epsabs;              /*  Absolute accuracy requested.                                */
00258 double   epsrel;              /*  Relative accuracy requested.                                */
00259 int      limit;
00260 double  *result;              /*  The desired result. I.e. integral of f() from a to b        */
00261 double  *abserr;              /*  Estimate of the modulus of the absolute error in the result */
00262 int     *neval;               /*  The number of integrand evaluations performed.              */
00263 int     *ier;                 /*  Error flag. An error occurred if ier > 0. See below.        */
00264 double   *alist;
00265 double   *blist;
00266 double   *rlist;
00267 double   *elist;
00268 int  *iord;
00269 int *last;
00270 {
00271 
00272 
00273 
00274 
00275     /*
00276      *
00277      *    Begin prologue:       dqagse
00278      *    date written   800101   (yymmdd)
00279      *    revision date  830518   (yymmdd)
00280      *    category no.  h2a1a1
00281      *    keywords  automatic integrator, general-purpose,
00282      *              (end point) singularities, extrapolation,
00283      *              globally adaptive
00284      *    author  piessens,robert,appl. math. & progr. div. - k.u.leuven
00285      *            de doncker,elise,appl. math. & progr. div. - k.u.leuven
00286      *    purpose  the routine calculates an approximation result to a given
00287      *             definite integral i = integral of f over (a,b),
00288      *             hopefully satisfying following claim for accuracy
00289      *             abs(i-result).le.max(epsabs,epsrel*abs(i)).
00290      *    description
00291      *
00292      *        computation of a definite integral
00293      *        standard fortran subroutine
00294      *        double precision version
00295      *
00296      *        parameters
00297      *         on entry
00298      *            f      - double precision
00299      *                     function subprogram defining the integrand
00300      *                     function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
00301      *                     declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
00302      *
00303      *            a      - double precision
00304      *                     lower limit of integration
00305      *
00306      *            b      - double precision
00307      *                     upper limit of integration
00308      *
00309      *            epsabs - double precision
00310      *                     absolute accuracy requested
00311      *            epsrel - double precision
00312      *                     relative accuracy requested
00313      *                     if  epsabs.le.0
00314      *                     and epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28),
00315      *                     the routine will end with ier = 6.
00316      *
00317      *            limit  - integer
00318      *                     gives an upperbound on the number of subintervals
00319      *                     in the partition of (a,b)
00320      *
00321      *         on return
00322      *            result - double precision
00323      *                     approximation to the integral
00324      *
00325      *            abserr - double precision
00326      *                     estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
00327      *                     which should equal or exceed abs(i-result)
00328      *
00329      *            neval  - integer
00330      *                     number of integrand evaluations
00331      *
00332      *            ier    - integer
00333      *                     ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the
00334      *                             routine. it is assumed that the requested
00335      *                             accuracy has been achieved.
00336      *                     ier.gt.0 abnormal termination of the routine
00337      *                             the estimates for integral and error are
00338      *                             less reliable. it is assumed that the
00339      *                             requested accuracy has not been achieved.
00340      *            error messages
00341      *                         = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed
00342      *                             has been achieved. one can allow more sub-
00343      *                             divisions by increasing the value of limit
00344      *                             (and taking the according dimension
00345      *                             adjustments into account). however, if
00346      *                             this yields no improvement it is advised
00347      *                             to analyze the integrand in order to
00348      *                             determine the integration difficulties. if
00349      *                             the position of a local difficulty can be
00350      *                             determined (e.g. singularity,
00351      *                             discontinuity within the interval) one
00352      *                             will probably gain from splitting up the
00353      *                             interval at this point and calling the
00354      *                             integrator on the subranges. if possible,
00355      *                             an appropriate special-purpose integrator
00356      *                             should be used, which is designed for
00357      *                             handling the type of difficulty involved.
00358      *                         = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is detec-
00359      *                             ted, which prevents the requested
00360      *                             tolerance from being achieved.
00361      *                             the error may be under-estimated.
00362      *                         = 3 extremely bad integrand behaviour
00363      *                             occurs at some points of the integration
00364      *                             interval.
00365      *                         = 4 the algorithm does not converge.
00366      *                             roundoff error is detected in the
00367      *                             extrapolation table.
00368      *                             it is presumed that the requested
00369      *                             tolerance cannot be achieved, and that the
00370      *                             returned result is the best which can be
00371      *                             obtained.
00372      *                         = 5 the integral is probably divergent, or
00373      *                             slowly convergent. it must be noted that
00374      *                             divergence can occur with any other value
00375      *                             of ier.
00376      *                         = 6 the input is invalid, because
00377      *                             epsabs.le.0 and
00378      *                             epsrel.lt.max(50*rel.mach.acc.,0.5d-28).
00379      *                             result, abserr, neval, last, rlist(1),
00380      *                             iord(1) and elist(1) are set to zero.
00381      *                             alist(1) and blist(1) are set to a and b
00382      *                             respectively.
00383      *
00384      *            alist  - double precision
00385      *                     vector of dimension at least limit, the first
00386      *                      last  elements of which are the left end points
00387      *                     of the subintervals in the partition of the
00388      *                     given integration range (a,b)
00389      *
00390      *            blist  - double precision
00391      *                     vector of dimension at least limit, the first
00392      *                      last  elements of which are the right end points
00393      *                     of the subintervals in the partition of the given
00394      *                     integration range (a,b)
00395      *
00396      *            rlist  - double precision
00397      *                     vector of dimension at least limit, the first
00398      *                      last  elements of which are the integral
00399      *                     approximations on the subintervals
00400      *
00401      *            elist  - double precision
00402      *                     vector of dimension at least limit, the first
00403      *                      last  elements of which are the moduli of the
00404      *                     absolute error estimates on the subintervals
00405      *
00406      *            iord   - integer
00407      *                     vector of dimension at least limit, the first k
00408      *                     elements of which are pointers to the
00409      *                     error estimates over the subintervals,
00410      *                     such that elist(iord(1)), ..., elist(iord(k))
00411      *                     form a decreasing sequence, with k = last
00412      *                     if last.le.(limit/2+2), and k = limit+1-last
00413      *                     otherwise
00414      *
00415      *            last   - integer
00416      *                     number of subintervals actually produced in the
00417      *                     subdivision process
00418      *
00419      *   references  (none)
00420      *   routines called  d1mach,dqelg,dqk21,dqpsrt
00421      *   end prologue  dqagse
00422      */
00423 
00424 
00425 
00426     double  area, abseps, area1, area12, area2, a1;
00427     double      a2, b1, b2, correc=0.0, defabs, defab1, defab2, d1mach();
00428     double      dres, epmach, erlarg=0.0, erlast, errbnd, errmax;
00429     double      error1, error2, erro12, errsum, ertest=0.0, oflow, resabs, reseps; 
00430     double      res3la[4], rlist2[53], small=0.0, uflow;
00431     int     id, ierro, iroff1, iroff2, iroff3, jupbnd, k, ksgn;
00432     int     ktmin, maxerr, nres, nrmax, numrl2;
00433     int     extrap, noext;
00434     int     crap = 0;
00435 
00436 
00437 
00438 
00439     /*
00440      *            the dimension of rlist2 is determined by the value of
00441      *            limexp in subroutine dqelg (rlist2 should be of dimension
00442      *            (limexp+2) at least).
00443      *
00444      *            list of major variables
00445      *            -----------------------
00446      *
00447      *           alist     - list of left end points of all subintervals
00448      *                       considered up to now
00449      *           blist     - list of right end points of all subintervals
00450      *                       considered up to now
00451      *           rlist(i)  - approximation to the integral over
00452      *                       (alist(i),blist(i))
00453      *           rlist2    - array of dimension at least limexp+2 containing
00454      *                       the part of the epsilon table which is still
00455      *                       needed for further computations
00456      *           elist(i)  - error estimate applying to rlist(i)
00457      *           maxerr    - pointer to the interval with largest error
00458      *                       estimate
00459      *           errmax    - elist(maxerr)
00460      *           erlast    - error on the interval currently subdivided
00461      *                       (before that subdivision has taken place)
00462      *           area      - sum of the integrals over the subintervals
00463      *           errsum    - sum of the errors over the subintervals
00464      *           errbnd    - requested accuracy max(epsabs,epsrel*
00465      *                       abs(result))
00466      *           *****1    - variable for the left interval
00467      *           *****2    - variable for the right interval
00468      *           last      - index for subdivision
00469      *           nres      - number of calls to the extrapolation routine
00470      *           numrl2    - number of elements currently in rlist2. if an
00471      *                       appropriate approximation to the compounded
00472      *                       integral has been obtained it is put in
00473      *                       rlist2(numrl2) after numrl2 has been increased
00474      *                       by one.
00475      *           small     - length of the smallest interval considered up
00476      *                       to now, multiplied by 1.5
00477      *           erlarg    - sum of the errors over the intervals larger
00478      *                       than the smallest interval considered up to now
00479      *           extrap    - logical variable denoting that the routine is
00480      *                       attempting to perform extrapolation i.e. before
00481      *                       subdividing the smallest interval we try to
00482      *                       decrease the value of erlarg.
00483      *           noext     - logical variable denoting that extrapolation
00484      *                       is no longer allowed (true value)
00485      *
00486      *            machine dependent constants
00487      *            ---------------------------
00488      *
00489      *           epmach is the largest relative spacing.
00490      *           uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
00491      *           oflow is the largest positive magnitude.
00492      */
00493 
00494 
00495 
00496 
00497     /*  first executable statement  dqagse */
00498     epmach = d1mach(4);
00499 
00500 
00501 
00502 
00503     /*
00504      *             test on validity of parameters
00505      */
00506     *ier = 0;
00507     *neval = 0;
00508     *last = 0;
00509     *result = 0.0;
00510     *abserr = 0.0;
00511     alist[1] = a;
00512     blist[1] = b;
00513     rlist[1] = 0.0;
00514     elist[1] = 0.0;
00515     if( (epsabs <= 0.0) && (epsrel < dmax1(50.0*epmach, 0.5e-28))  ) {
00516     *ier = 6;
00517     return(-1);
00518     }
00519 
00520 
00521 
00522 
00523     /*
00524      *           first approximation to the integral
00525      *           -----------------------------------
00526      */
00527     uflow = d1mach(1);
00528     oflow = d1mach(2);
00529     ierro = 0;
00530     dqk21(f, qpInfo, a, b, result, abserr, &defabs, &resabs);
00531 
00532 
00533 
00534     /*
00535      *           test on accuracy.
00536      */
00537     dres = fabs(*result);
00538     errbnd = dmax1(epsabs, epsrel*dres);
00539     *last = 1;
00540     rlist[1] = *result;
00541     elist[1] = *abserr;
00542     iord[1] = 1;
00543     if (  (*abserr <= 100.0*epmach*defabs) && (*abserr > errbnd)  ) *ier = 2;
00544     if (limit == 1) *ier = 1;
00545     if (  (*ier != 0) || ( (*abserr <= errbnd) && (*abserr != resabs)) ||  (*abserr == 0.0)  ) {
00546     *neval = 42 * *last - 21;
00547     return(0);
00548     }
00549 
00550 
00551 
00552     /*
00553      *           initialization
00554      *           --------------
00555      */
00556     rlist2[1] = *result;
00557     errmax = *abserr;
00558     maxerr = 1;
00559     area = *result;
00560     errsum = *abserr;
00561     *abserr = oflow;
00562     nrmax = 1;
00563     nres = 0;
00564     numrl2 = 2;
00565     ktmin = 0;
00566     extrap = FALSE;
00567     noext = FALSE;
00568     iroff1 = 0;
00569     iroff2 = 0;
00570     iroff3 = 0;
00571     ksgn = -1;
00572     if(dres >= (1.0 - 50.0*epmach)*defabs) ksgn = 1;
00573 
00574 
00575 
00576 
00577 
00578 
00579     /*
00580      *           main do-loop
00581      *           ------------
00582      */
00583     for (*last = 2; *last <= limit; ++(*last)) {
00584 
00585 
00586         /*
00587          *           bisect the subinterval with the nrmax-th largest error
00588          *           estimate.
00589          */
00590         a1 = alist[maxerr];
00591         b1 = 0.5*(alist[maxerr] + blist[maxerr]);
00592         a2 = b1;
00593         b2 = blist[maxerr];
00594         erlast = errmax;
00595         dqk21(f, qpInfo, a1, b1, &area1, &error1, &resabs, &defab1);
00596         dqk21(f, qpInfo, a2, b2, &area2, &error2, &resabs, &defab2);
00597 
00598 
00599 
00600         /*
00601          *           improve previous approximations to integral
00602          *           and error and test for accuracy.
00603          */
00604         area12 = area1+area2;
00605         erro12 = error1+error2;
00606         errsum += erro12-errmax;
00607         area += area12-rlist[maxerr];
00608 
00609 
00610         if (  (defab1 != error1) && (defab2 != error2)  ) {
00611 
00612             if (  (fabs(rlist[maxerr]-area12) <= 0.1e-4*fabs(area12)) && (erro12 >= 0.99*errmax)  ) { 
00613                 if (extrap) ++iroff2;
00614                 if (!extrap) ++iroff1;
00615         }
00616         if ( (*last > 10) && (erro12 > errmax) ) ++iroff3;
00617 
00618     }
00619 
00620 
00621     rlist[maxerr] = area1;
00622         rlist[*last] = area2;
00623         errbnd = dmax1( epsabs, epsrel*fabs(area) );
00624 
00625 
00626 
00627 
00628         /*
00629          *           test for roundoff error and eventually set error flag.
00630          */
00631         if ( (iroff1+iroff2 >= 10) || (iroff3 >= 20) ) *ier = 2;
00632         if (iroff2 >= 5) ierro = 3;
00633 
00634 
00635 
00636         /*
00637          *           set error flag in the case that the number of subintervals
00638          *           equals limit.
00639          */
00640         if (*last == limit) *ier = 1;
00641 
00642 
00643 
00644         /*
00645          *           set error flag in the case of bad integrand behaviour
00646          *           at a point of the integration range.
00647          */
00648         if ( dmax1(fabs(a1), fabs(b2)) <= ((1.0+100.0*epmach)*(fabs(a2)+1000.0*uflow)) ) *ier = 4;
00649 
00650 
00651 
00652         /*
00653          *           append the newly-created intervals to the list.
00654          */
00655         if(error2 > error1) { 
00656 
00657             alist[maxerr] = a2;
00658             alist[*last] = a1;
00659             blist[*last] = b1;
00660             rlist[maxerr] = area2;
00661             rlist[*last] = area1;
00662             elist[maxerr] = error2;
00663             elist[*last] = error1;
00664 
00665     } else {
00666 
00667             alist[*last] = a2;
00668             blist[maxerr] = b1;
00669             blist[*last] = b2;
00670             elist[maxerr] = error1;
00671             elist[*last] = error2;
00672 
00673     }
00674 
00675 
00676 
00677 
00678 
00679 
00680     /*
00681      *           call subroutine dqpsrt to maintain the descending ordering
00682      *           in the list of error estimates and select the subinterval
00683      *           with nrmax-th largest error estimate (to be bisected next).
00684      */
00685     dqpsrt(limit, *last, &maxerr, &errmax, elist, iord, &nrmax);
00686 
00687 
00688 
00689     /*  
00690      *  Jump out of do-loop
00691      */
00692         if (errsum <= errbnd) goto L115;
00693 
00694 
00695     /*  
00696      *  Jump out of do-loop
00697      */
00698         if (*ier != 0) break;
00699 
00700         if (*last == 2) {
00701         small = fabs(b-a)*0.375;
00702         erlarg = errsum;
00703         ertest = errbnd;
00704         rlist2[2] = area;
00705     
00706         goto L90;
00707     }
00708 
00709 
00710 
00711 
00712         if ( !noext ) {
00713 
00714 
00715             erlarg -= erlast;
00716             if( fabs(b1-a1) > small ) erlarg += erro12;
00717 
00718 
00719             if ( !extrap ) {
00720                 /*
00721              *           test whether the interval to be bisected next is the
00722              *           smallest interval.
00723              */
00724                 if ( fabs(blist[maxerr]-alist[maxerr]) > small ) goto L90;
00725                 extrap = TRUE;
00726                 nrmax = 2;
00727         }
00728 
00729 
00730 
00731         if( (ierro != 3) && (erlarg > ertest) ) {
00732 
00733         /*
00734          *           the smallest interval has the largest error.
00735          *           before bisecting decrease the sum of the errors over the
00736          *           larger intervals (erlarg) and perform extrapolation.
00737          */
00738         id = nrmax;
00739         jupbnd = *last;
00740         if(*last > (2+limit/2)) jupbnd = limit+3- (*last);
00741 
00742         for (k = id; k<=jupbnd; ++k) {
00743 
00744             maxerr = iord[nrmax];
00745             errmax = elist[maxerr];
00746 
00747             /*  
00748              *  Jump out of do-loop
00749              */
00750             if ( fabs(blist[maxerr]-alist[maxerr]) > small ) goto L90;
00751             ++nrmax;
00752 
00753         }
00754         }
00755 
00756 
00757 
00758 
00759         /*
00760          *           perform extrapolation.
00761          */
00762         ++numrl2;
00763         rlist2[numrl2] = area;
00764         dqelg(numrl2, rlist2, &reseps, &abseps, res3la, &nres);
00765         ++ktmin;
00766         if( (ktmin > 5) && (*abserr < 0.1e-2*errsum) ) *ier = 5;
00767 
00768 
00769 
00770 
00771         if( abseps < *abserr ) {
00772         ktmin = 0;
00773         *abserr = abseps;
00774         *result = reseps;
00775         correc = erlarg;
00776         ertest = dmax1( epsabs, epsrel*fabs(reseps) );
00777         /*  
00778          *  Jump out of do-loop
00779          */
00780         if( *abserr <= ertest ) break;
00781         }
00782 
00783 
00784 
00785         /*
00786          *           prepare bisection of the smallest interval.
00787          */
00788         if ( numrl2 == 1 ) noext = TRUE;
00789         if ( *ier == 5 ) break;
00790         maxerr = iord[1];
00791         errmax = elist[maxerr];
00792         nrmax = 1;
00793         extrap = FALSE;
00794         small *= 0.5;
00795         erlarg = errsum;
00796 
00797     }
00798 
00799 
00800 L90:
00801     crap = 0;
00802 
00803     }  
00804 
00805 
00806 
00807 
00808 
00809 
00810 
00811 
00812 
00813 
00814     /*
00815      *           set final result and error estimate.
00816      *           ------------------------------------
00817      *   I dont have time to pretty up all these ugly goto's right now! -- MGH
00818      */
00819     if (*abserr == oflow) goto L115;
00820     if (*ier+ierro == 0) goto L110;
00821     if (ierro == 3) *abserr += correc;
00822     if (*ier == 0) *ier = 3;
00823     if ( (*result != 0.0) && (area != 0.0) ) goto L105;
00824     if (*abserr > errsum) goto L115;
00825     if (area == 0.0) goto L130;
00826     goto L110;
00827 
00828 L105:
00829     if(*abserr/fabs(*result) > errsum/fabs(area)) goto L115;
00830 
00831 
00832 
00833     /*
00834      *           test on divergence.
00835      */
00836 L110:
00837     if(ksgn == (-1) && dmax1(fabs(*result), fabs(area)) <=  defabs*0.01) goto L130;
00838     if( (0.01 > (*result/area)) || ((*result/area) > 100.0) || (errsum > fabs(area))  ) *ier = 6;
00839     goto L130;
00840 
00841 
00842 
00843     /*
00844      *           compute global integral sum.
00845      */
00846 L115:
00847     *result = 0.0;
00848     for (k=1; k<= (*last); ++k) *result += rlist[k];
00849     *abserr = errsum;
00850 
00851 L130:
00852     if (*ier > 2) --(*ier);
00853 //L140:
00854     *neval = 42*(*last) - 21;
00855 
00856     return(0);
00857 
00858 
00859 }
00860 
00861 
00862 
00863 
00864 
00865 /*
00866  *      QUADPACK DQELG Routine converted to C
00867  */
00868 int dqelg(int n, double epstab[], double *result, double *abserr, double res3la[], int *nres) {
00869 
00870 
00871     /*
00872      *
00873      *    Begin prologue:       dqpelg
00874      *    refer to  dqagie,dqagoe,dqagpe,dqagse
00875      *    routines called  d1mach
00876      *    revision date  830518   (yymmdd)
00877      *    keywords  epsilon algorithm, convergence acceleration,
00878      *              extrapolation
00879      *    author  piessens,robert,appl. math. & progr. div. - k.u.leuven
00880      *           de doncker,elise,appl. math & progr. div. - k.u.leuven
00881      *    purpose  the routine determines the limit of a given sequence of
00882      *            approximations, by means of the epsilon algorithm of
00883      *            p.wynn. an estimate of the absolute error is also given.
00884      *            the condensed epsilon table is computed. only those
00885      *            elements needed for the computation of the next diagonal
00886      *            are preserved.
00887      *    *    description
00888      *
00889      *           epsilon algorithm
00890      *           standard fortran subroutine
00891      *           double precision version
00892      *
00893      *           parameters
00894      *              n      - integer
00895      *                       epstab(n) contains the new element in the
00896      *                       first column of the epsilon table.
00897      *
00898      *              epstab - double precision
00899      *                       vector of dimension 52 containing the elements
00900      *                       of the two lower diagonals of the triangular
00901      *                       epsilon table. the elements are numbered
00902      *                       starting at the right-hand corner of the
00903      *                       triangle.
00904      *
00905      *              result - double precision
00906      *                       resulting approximation to the integral
00907      *
00908      *              abserr - double precision
00909      *                       estimate of the absolute error computed from
00910      *                       result and the 3 previous results
00911      *
00912      *              res3la - double precision
00913      *                       vector of dimension 3 containing the last 3
00914      *                       results
00915      *
00916      *              nres   - integer
00917      *                       number of calls to the routine
00918      *                       (should be zero at first call)
00919      *
00920      *    end prologue  dqelg
00921      */
00922 
00923 
00924 
00925 
00926     double  delta1, delta2, delta3, d1mach();
00927     double  epmach, epsinf, error, err1, err2, err3, e0, e1, e1abs, e2, e3;
00928     double  oflow, res, ss, tol1, tol2, tol3;
00929     int     i, ib, ib2, ie, indx, k1, k2, k3, limexp, newelm, num;
00930 
00931 
00932 
00933     /*
00934      *           list of major variables
00935      *           -----------------------
00936      *
00937      *           e0     - the 4 elements on which the computation of a new
00938      *           e1       element in the epsilon table is based
00939      *           e2
00940      *           e3                 e0
00941      *                        e3    e1    new
00942      *                              e2
00943      *           newelm - number of elements to be computed in the new
00944      *                    diagonal
00945      *           error  - error = abs(e1-e0)+abs(e2-e1)+abs(new-e2)
00946      *           result - the element in the new diagonal with least value
00947      *                    of error
00948      *
00949      *           machine dependent constants
00950      *           ---------------------------
00951      *
00952      *           epmach is the largest relative spacing.
00953      *           oflow is the largest positive magnitude.
00954      *           limexp is the maximum number of elements the epsilon
00955      *           table can contain. if this number is reached, the upper
00956      *           diagonal of the epsilon table is deleted.
00957      */
00958 
00959 
00960 
00961 
00962 
00963     /*
00964      *    first executable statement  dqelg
00965      */
00966     epmach = d1mach(4);
00967     oflow = d1mach(2);
00968     ++(*nres);
00969     *abserr = oflow;
00970     *result = epstab[n];
00971     if ( n < 3 ) {
00972     *abserr = dmax1(*abserr, 5.0*epmach*fabs( *result ));
00973     return(0);
00974     }
00975     limexp = 50;
00976     epstab[n+2] = epstab[n];
00977     newelm = (n-1)/2;
00978     epstab[n] = oflow;
00979     num = n;
00980     k1 = n;
00981 
00982     for (i = 1; i <= newelm; ++i) {
00983         k2 = k1-1;
00984         k3 = k1-2;
00985         res = epstab[k1+2];
00986         e0 = epstab[k3];
00987         e1 = epstab[k2];
00988         e2 = res;
00989         e1abs = fabs(e1);
00990         delta2 = e2-e1;
00991         err2 = fabs(delta2);
00992         tol2 = dmax1(fabs(e2), e1abs)*epmach;
00993         delta3 = e1-e0;
00994         err3 = fabs(delta3);
00995         tol3 = dmax1(e1abs, fabs(e0))*epmach;
00996 
00997         if( (err2 <= tol2) && (err3 <= tol3)) {
00998 
00999         /*
01000          *           if e0, e1 and e2 are equal to within machine
01001          *           accuracy, convergence is assumed.
01002          *           result = e2
01003          *           abserr = abs(e1-e0)+abs(e2-e1)
01004          */
01005         *result = res;
01006         *abserr = err2+err3;
01007         /*
01008          *   jump out of do-loop
01009          */
01010         *abserr = dmax1(*abserr, 5.0*epmach*fabs( *result ));
01011         return(0);
01012     }
01013 
01014 
01015     e3 = epstab[k1];
01016         epstab[k1] = e1;
01017         delta1 = e1-e3;
01018         err1 = fabs(delta1);
01019         tol1 = dmax1(e1abs, fabs(e3))*epmach;
01020 
01021 
01022     /*
01023      *           if two elements are very close to each other, omit
01024      *           a part of the table by adjusting the value of n
01025      */
01026         if( (err1 <= tol1) || (err2 <= tol2) || (err3 <= tol3) ) {
01027         n = i+i-1;
01028         /*
01029          *    jump out of do-loop
01030          */
01031         break;
01032 
01033     } 
01034         ss = 1.0/delta1+1.0/delta2-1.0/delta3;
01035         epsinf = fabs(ss*e1);
01036 
01037 
01038 
01039 
01040     /*
01041      *           test to detect irregular behaviour in the table, and
01042      *           eventually omit a part of the table adjusting the value
01043      *           of n.
01044      */
01045         if( epsinf <= 0.1e-3 ) {
01046 
01047         n = i+i-1;
01048         /*
01049          *    jump out of do-loop
01050          */
01051         break;
01052 
01053     } else {
01054 
01055         /*
01056              *           compute a new element and eventually adjust
01057              *           the value of result.
01058              */
01059         res = e1+1.0/ss;
01060         epstab[k1] = res;
01061         k1 = k1-2;
01062         error = err2+fabs(res-e2)+err3;
01063         if (error <= *abserr) {
01064         *abserr = error;
01065         *result = res;
01066         }
01067 
01068     }
01069 
01070     }   
01071 
01072 
01073 
01074 
01075     /*
01076      *           shift the table.
01077      */
01078     if ( n == limexp ) n = 2*(limexp/2)-1;
01079 
01080     ib = 1;
01081     if ( (num/2)*2 == num ) ib = 2;
01082     ie = newelm+1;
01083 
01084     for (i=1; i<=ie; ++i) {
01085         ib2 = ib+2;
01086         epstab[ib] = epstab[ib2];
01087         ib = ib2;
01088     }
01089 
01090     if ( num != n ) {
01091         indx = num-n+1;
01092         for (i = 1; i<=n; ++i) {
01093             epstab[i]= epstab[indx];
01094             ++indx;
01095         }
01096     }
01097 
01098 
01099     if ( *nres < 4 ) {
01100 
01101         res3la[*nres] = *result;
01102         *abserr = oflow;
01103 
01104     } else {
01105 
01106         /*
01107          *           compute error estimate
01108          */
01109     *abserr = fabs( *result-res3la[3] ) + fabs( *result-res3la[2] ) + fabs( *result-res3la[1] );
01110     res3la[1] = res3la[2];
01111     res3la[2] = res3la[3];
01112     res3la[3] = *result;
01113 
01114     }
01115 
01116     *abserr = dmax1(*abserr, 5.0*epmach*fabs( *result ));
01117 
01118     return( 0 );
01119 
01120 
01121 }
01122 
01123 
01124 
01125 
01126 
01127 /*
01128  *      QUADPACK DQK21 Routine converted to C
01129  */
01130 int dqk21(f, qpInfo, a, b, result, abserr, resabs, resasc)
01131 double  (*f)( double, _qpInfo *); /*  The integrand function -- I.e. the function to integrate           */
01132 _qpInfo *qpInfo;                  /*  Auxilliary information to pass to function (to avoid making globals) */
01133 double   a;                   /*  Lower Limit of integration.                                 */
01134 double   b;                   /*  Upper limit of integration.                                 */
01135 double  *result;              /*  The desired result. I.e. integral of f() from a to b        */
01136 double  *abserr;              /*  Estimate of the modulus of the absolute error in the result */
01137 double  *resabs;              /*  */
01138 double  *resasc;              /*  */
01139 {
01140 
01141 
01142 
01143 
01144     /*
01145      *
01146      *    Begin prologue:       dqk21
01147      *    date written   800101   (yymmdd)
01148      *    revision date  830518   (yymmdd)
01149      *    category no.  h2a1a2
01150      *    keywords  21-point gauss-kronrod rules
01151      *    author  piessens,robert,appl. math. & progr. div. - k.u.leuven
01152      *           de doncker,elise,appl. math. & progr. div. - k.u.leuven
01153      *    purpose  to compute i = integral of f over (a,b), with error
01154      *                           estimate
01155      *                       j = integral of abs(f) over (a,b)
01156      *    description
01157      *
01158      *           integration rules
01159      *           standard fortran subroutine
01160      *           double precision version
01161      *
01162      *           parameters
01163      *            on entry
01164      *              f      - double precision
01165      *                       function subprogram defining the integrand
01166      *                       function f(x). the actual name for f needs to be
01167      *                       declared e x t e r n a l in the driver program.
01168      *
01169      *              a      - double precision
01170      *                       lower limit of integration
01171      *
01172      *              b      - double precision
01173      *                       upper limit of integration
01174      *
01175      *            on return
01176      *              result - double precision
01177      *                       approximation to the integral i
01178      *                       result is computed by applying the 21-point
01179      *                       kronrod rule (resk) obtained by optimal addition
01180      *                       of abscissae to the 10-point gauss rule (resg).
01181      *
01182      *              abserr - double precision
01183      *                       estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
01184      *                       which should not exceed abs(i-result)
01185      *
01186      *              resabs - double precision
01187      *                       approximation to the integral j
01188      *
01189      *              resasc - double precision
01190      *                       approximation to the integral of abs(f-i/(b-a))
01191      *                       over (a,b)
01192      *
01193      *      references  (none)
01194      *      routines called  d1mach
01195      *      end prologue  dqk21
01196      */
01197 
01198 
01199 
01200 
01201     double  absc, centr, dhlgth, d1mach();
01202     double  epmach, fc, fsum, fval1, fval2, fv1[11], fv2[11], hlgth;
01203     double  resg, resk, reskh, uflow;
01204     int     j, jtw, jtwm1;
01205 
01206 
01207 
01208 
01209  
01210     /*
01211      *           the abscissae and weights are given for the interval (-1,1).
01212      *           because of symmetry only the positive abscissae and their
01213      *           corresponding weights are given.
01214      *
01215      *           xgk    - abscissae of the 21-point kronrod rule
01216      *                    xgk(2), xgk(4), ...  abscissae of the 10-point
01217      *                    gauss rule
01218      *                    xgk(1), xgk(3), ...  abscissae which are optimally
01219      *                    added to the 10-point gauss rule
01220      *
01221      *           wgk    - weights of the 21-point kronrod rule
01222      *
01223      *           wg     - weights of the 10-point gauss rule
01224      *
01225      *
01226      * gauss quadrature weights and kronron quadrature abscissae and weights
01227      * as evaluated with 80 decimal digit arithmetic by l. w. fullerton,
01228      * bell labs, nov. 1981.
01229      */
01230 
01231 
01232 
01233     double wg[] = {     0.0,
01234         0.066671344308688137593568809893332,
01235         0.149451349150580593145776339657697,
01236         0.219086362515982043995534934228163,
01237         0.269266719309996355091226921569469,
01238         0.295524224714752870173892994651338 };
01239 
01240     double xgk[] = {    0.0,
01241         0.995657163025808080735527280689003,
01242         0.973906528517171720077964012084452,
01243         0.930157491355708226001207180059508,
01244         0.865063366688984510732096688423493,
01245         0.780817726586416897063717578345042,
01246         0.679409568299024406234327365114874,
01247         0.562757134668604683339000099272694,
01248         0.433395394129247190799265943165784,
01249         0.294392862701460198131126603103866,
01250         0.148874338981631210884826001129720,
01251         0.000000000000000000000000000000000 };
01252  
01253     double wgk[] = {    0.0,
01254         0.011694638867371874278064396062192,
01255         0.032558162307964727478818972459390,
01256         0.054755896574351996031381300244580,
01257         0.075039674810919952767043140916190,
01258         0.093125454583697605535065465083366,
01259         0.109387158802297641899210590325805,
01260         0.123491976262065851077958109831074,
01261         0.134709217311473325928054001771707,
01262         0.142775938577060080797094273138717,
01263         0.147739104901338491374841515972068,
01264         0.149445554002916905664936468389821 };
01265 
01266 
01267 
01268     /*
01269      *
01270      *           list of major variables
01271      *           -----------------------
01272      *
01273      *           centr  - mid point of the interval
01274      *           hlgth  - half-length of the interval
01275      *           absc   - abscissa
01276      *           fval*  - function value
01277      *           resg   - result of the 10-point gauss formula
01278      *           resk   - result of the 21-point kronrod formula
01279      *           reskh  - approximation to the mean value of f over (a,b),
01280      *                    i.e. to i/(b-a)
01281      *
01282      *
01283      *           machine dependent constants
01284      *           ---------------------------
01285      *
01286      *           epmach is the largest relative spacing.
01287      *           uflow is the smallest positive magnitude.
01288      */
01289 
01290 
01291 
01292 
01293     /*
01294      *   first executable statement  dqk21
01295      */
01296     epmach = d1mach(4);
01297     uflow = d1mach(1);
01298  
01299     centr = 0.5*(a+b);
01300     hlgth = 0.5*(b-a);
01301     dhlgth = fabs(hlgth);
01302 
01303 
01304     /*
01305      *           compute the 21-point kronrod approximation to
01306      *           the integral, and estimate the absolute error.
01307      */
01308     resg = 0.0;
01309     fc = (*f)(centr, qpInfo);
01310     resk = wgk[11]*fc;
01311     *resabs = fabs(resk);
01312 
01313     for (j=1; j<=5; ++j) {
01314         jtw = 2*j;
01315         absc = hlgth*xgk[jtw];
01316         fval1 = (*f)(centr-absc, qpInfo);
01317         fval2 = (*f)(centr+absc, qpInfo);
01318         fv1[jtw] = fval1;
01319         fv2[jtw] = fval2;
01320         fsum = fval1+fval2;
01321         resg += wg[j]*fsum;
01322         resk += wgk[jtw]*fsum;
01323         *resabs += wgk[jtw]*(fabs(fval1)+fabs(fval2));
01324     }
01325 
01326 
01327 
01328     for (j = 1; j<=5; ++j) {
01329         jtwm1 = 2*j-1;
01330         absc = hlgth*xgk[jtwm1];
01331         fval1 = (*f)(centr-absc, qpInfo);
01332         fval2 = (*f)(centr+absc, qpInfo);
01333         fv1[jtwm1] = fval1;
01334         fv2[jtwm1] = fval2;
01335         fsum = fval1+fval2;
01336         resk += wgk[jtwm1]*fsum;
01337         *resabs += wgk[jtwm1]*(fabs(fval1)+fabs(fval2));
01338     }
01339 
01340 
01341 
01342     reskh = resk*0.5;
01343     *resasc = wgk[11]*fabs(fc-reskh);
01344 
01345     for (j=1; j<=10; ++j) *resasc += wgk[j]*(fabs(fv1[j]-reskh)+fabs(fv2[j]-reskh));
01346 
01347     *result = resk*hlgth;
01348     *resabs *= dhlgth;
01349     *resasc *= dhlgth;
01350     *abserr = fabs((resk-resg)*hlgth);
01351 
01352     if( (*resasc != 0.0) && (*abserr != 0.0)) *abserr = *resasc*dmin1( 1.0, pow(200.0*(*abserr)/(*resasc), 1.5) );
01353 
01354     if ( *resabs > uflow/(50.0*epmach) ) *abserr = dmax1( (epmach*50.0)*(*resabs), *abserr );
01355 
01356 
01357 
01358 
01359     return(1);
01360 
01361 
01362 
01363 
01364 }
01365 
01366 
01367 
01368 
01369 
01370 
01371 
01372 /*
01373  *      QUADPACK DQPSRT Routine converted to C
01374  */
01375 int dqpsrt(int limit, int last, int *maxerr, double *ermax, double elist[], int iord[], int *nrmax) {
01376 
01377 
01378 
01379     /*
01380      *
01381      *    Begin prologue:       dqpsrt
01382      *    refer to  dqage,dqagie,dqagpe,dqawse
01383      *    routines called  (none)
01384      *    revision date  810101   (yymmdd)
01385      *    keywords  sequential sorting
01386      *    author  piessens,robert,appl. math. & progr. div. - k.u.leuven
01387      *           de doncker,elise,appl. math. & progr. div. - k.u.leuven
01388      *    purpose  this routine maintains the descending ordering in the
01389      *            list of the local error estimated resulting from the
01390      *            interval subdivision process. at each call two error
01391      *            estimates are inserted using the sequential search
01392      *            method, top-down for the largest error estimate and
01393      *            bottom-up for the smallest error estimate.
01394      *    description
01395      *
01396      *           ordering routine
01397      *           standard fortran subroutine
01398      *           double precision version
01399      *
01400      *           parameters (meaning at output)
01401      *              limit  - integer
01402      *                       maximum number of error estimates the list
01403      *                       can contain
01404      *
01405      *              last   - integer
01406      *                       number of error estimates currently in the list
01407      *
01408      *              maxerr - integer
01409      *                       maxerr points to the nrmax-th largest error
01410      *                       estimate currently in the list
01411      *
01412      *              ermax  - double precision
01413      *                       nrmax-th largest error estimate
01414      *                       ermax = elist(maxerr)
01415      *
01416      *              elist  - double precision
01417      *                       vector of dimension last containing
01418      *                       the error estimates
01419      *
01420      *              iord   - integer
01421      *                       vector of dimension last, the first k elements
01422      *                       of which contain pointers to the error
01423      *                       estimates, such that
01424      *                       elist(iord(1)),...,  elist(iord(k))
01425      *                       form a decreasing sequence, with
01426      *                       k = last if last.le.(limit/2+2), and
01427      *                       k = limit+1-last otherwise
01428      *
01429      *              nrmax  - integer
01430      *                       maxerr = iord(nrmax)
01431      *
01432      *     end prologue  dqpsrt
01433      */
01434 
01435 
01436 
01437     double  errmax, errmin;
01438     int     i, ibeg, ido, isucc, j, jbnd, jupbn, k;
01439 
01440 
01441 
01442 
01443     /*
01444      *           check whether the list contains more than
01445      *           two error estimates.
01446      */
01447 
01448 
01449 
01450     /*
01451      *    first executable statement  dqpsrt
01452      */
01453     if ( last <= 2 ) {
01454         iord[1] = 1;
01455         iord[2] = 2;
01456     } else {
01457 
01458 
01459 
01460         /*
01461          *           this part of the routine is only executed if, due to a
01462          *           difficult integrand, subdivision increased the error
01463          *           estimate. in the normal case the insert procedure should
01464          *           start after the nrmax-th largest error estimate.
01465          */
01466     errmax = elist[*maxerr];
01467     if(*nrmax != 1) {
01468         ido = *nrmax-1;
01469         for (i = 1; i<=ido; ++i) {
01470             isucc = iord[*nrmax-1];
01471             /*
01472              *    jump out of do-loop
01473              */
01474             if(errmax <= elist[isucc]) break;
01475             iord[*nrmax] = isucc;
01476             --(*nrmax);
01477         }
01478     }
01479 
01480 
01481 
01482         /*
01483          *           compute the number of elements in the list to be maintained
01484          *           in descending order. this number depends on the number of
01485          *           subdivisions still allowed.
01486          */
01487     jupbn = last;
01488     if(last > (limit/2+2)) jupbn = limit+3-last;
01489     errmin = elist[last];
01490 
01491 
01492 
01493     /*
01494      *           insert errmax by traversing the list top-down,
01495      *           starting comparison from the element elist(iord(nrmax+1)).
01496      */
01497     jbnd = jupbn-1;
01498     ibeg = *nrmax+1;
01499     if(ibeg > jbnd) goto L50;
01500 
01501     for (i=ibeg; i<=jbnd; ++i) {
01502             isucc = iord[i];
01503         /*
01504          *   jump out of do-loop
01505          */
01506             if(errmax >= elist[isucc]) goto L60;
01507             iord[i-1] = isucc;
01508     }
01509 
01510 
01511 L50:
01512     iord[jbnd] = *maxerr;
01513     iord[jupbn] = last;
01514     goto L90;
01515 
01516 
01517 
01518     /*
01519      *           insert errmin by traversing the list bottom-up.
01520      */
01521 L60:
01522     iord[i-1] = *maxerr;
01523     k = jbnd;
01524 
01525     for (j=i; j<=jbnd; ++j) {
01526         isucc = iord[k];
01527         /*
01528          *   jump out of do-loop
01529          */
01530         if(errmin < elist[isucc]) goto L80;
01531         iord[k+1] = isucc;
01532         --k;
01533     }
01534 
01535     iord[i] = last;
01536     goto L90;
01537 
01538 
01539 L80:
01540     iord[k+1] = last;
01541 
01542 
01543 
01544 
01545     }
01546 
01547     /*
01548      *           set maxerr and ermax.
01549      */
01550 L90:
01551     *maxerr = iord[*nrmax];
01552     *ermax = elist[*maxerr];
01553     return(1);
01554 
01555 
01556 }
01557 
01558 
01559 
01560 
01561     /*
01562      *   FIX, FIX !!! This routine needs to find these parameters automeatically!!!!
01563      *   d1mach( 1) = B^EMIN,           the smallest positive number.
01564      *   d1mach( 2) = (1-B^(-T-1)) B^EMAX,   the largest positive number.
01565      *   d1mach( 4) = B^(-T),   smallest number that when added to 1.0 gives something different from 1.0
01566      *   d1mach( 3) = B^(-T-1), smallest number that when subtracted from 1.0 gives something different from 1.0
01567      *   d1mach( 5) = log10(B)
01568      */
01569 
01570 /*
01571  *  For IEEE-compliant machines we should have (for double precision):
01572  *
01573  *      B    = 2
01574  *  EMIN = -1022
01575  *      EMAX = 1024
01576  *  T    = 52       (-T is the smallest power of B that added to 1.0 gives something different from 1.0)
01577  *  
01578  *   So this gives:
01579  *  
01580  *  B^EMIN   = 2.225073698e-308 
01581  *  B^EMAX   = 1.797693301e308      (B^EMAX - B^(-T-1)*B^EMAX is the same to within precision here )
01582  *  B^(-T-1) = 1.110223025e-16  (smallest number that when subtracted from 1.0 gives something different from 1.0)
01583  *  B^(-T)   = 2.220446049e-16  (smallest number that when added to 1.0 gives something different from 1.0)
01584  *
01585  */
01586 
01587 
01588 double d1mach( int i ) {
01589 
01590     switch (i) {
01591 
01592         case 1:
01593             return( 2.2250739e-308 );   /* assumes IEEE-compliant double precision machine */
01594             //return( 1.17549e-38 );
01595             break;
01596         case 2:
01597             return( 1.797693e308 );     /* assumes IEEE-compliant double precision machine */
01598             //return( 3.40282e+38 );
01599             break;
01600         case 3:
01601             return( 2.220446049e-16 );  /* assumes IEEE-compliant double precision machine */
01602             //return( 5.96046e-08 );    
01603             break;
01604         case 4:
01605             return( 1.110223025e-16 );  /* assumes IEEE-compliant double precision machine */
01606             //return( 1.19209e-07 );
01607             break;
01608         case 5:
01609             return( 0.301029995);   /* assumes IEEE-compliant machine */
01610             //return( 0.301029995);
01611             break;
01612     }
01613 
01614     return(-999.9);
01615 
01616 }
